content.webTitle: Blackpool face fight to keep Gary Taylor-Fletcher

fields.headline: Blackpool face fight to keep Gary Taylor-Fletcher
fields.bodyText: Blackpool face a battle to hold on to Gary Taylor-Fletcher, who has attracted interest from Swansea City and Queens Park Rangers as well a host of the club's Championship rivals. Ian Holloway, the Blackpool manager, is hopeful that the club can put together a new contract offer to prevent Taylor-Fletcher from following in the footsteps of Charlie Adam and David Vaughan, who have secured immediate returns to the Premier League following relegation. Adam joined Liverpool for £7m, while David Vaughan was signed by Sunderland on a free transfer. Taylor-Fletcher joined Blackpool from Huddersfield Town in 2007 and the forward has played 145 games for Blackpool, scoring 23 times.
